title: Clerks
text: This is where you manage which Clerks have access to the POS in a particular store or globally. You can make modifications to your list of clerks or you can use the Add Clerk button to create a new one. Use the toggle to ‘Show inactive clerks’. Clerk Number This must be a unique combination of numbers & letters that the Clerk will use to sign into the POS. Password This can be a combination of letters & numbers (special characters are excluded for ease of use and compatibility). *Clerk passwords should be secure but not too complex that it will cause issues. First Name First name of the Clerk. Last Name Last name of the Clerk. Phone Number Clerk Phone Number (Not used within the system. For reference purposes only). Email Clerk Email address (Not used within the system. For reference purposes only). Job Title The clerks job title within the company. Language The language used in the POS when this Clerk signs in. Manager This is linked to security options that the Clerk has. Local Shop Clerk Whether the Clerk is limited to 1 local shop or global. Shops Select the local shops for that clerk if 'Local Shop Clerk' is selected. Active It is possible to make Clerks inactive by deselecting this option. This may be preferable to deleting clerks.

title: Clerk Roles
text: Clerk Roles provide a means of organizing clerks into groups based on their permissions. This streamlines the process of assigning permissions to new clerks, making it faster and more efficient. Each role is associated with a Button Management profile, which controls the POS buttons that are available to all clerks belonging to that role. You have the flexibility to create as many different roles as you need. Using the drop-down menus, select which POS buttons will be available to clerks when assigned to the clerk role.

title: Expenses
text: On the Expenses page, you can input, modify, or remove expense information. Expense codes on this page are utilized through the POS system to track any expenses paid directly from the cash drawer. This could include payments for services such as window cleaning or purchasing cleaning supplies. Creating an Expense On the Expenses page, you will see your current expenses listed. To begin making a new Expense use the "Add Expense" button, this will take you to a new page. After completing the form, select the "Save" button. Once the form has been saved, a notification will display to confirm the successful save. Please keep in mind that after creating your expenses, you will need to link them to a group for them to be accessible through the POS system. This can be accomplished using the Groups module. When utilizing the Expenses feature via the POS, the expenses will be arranged in alphabetical order and identified by their assigned number. Additional information can be found in the Make Expense section. Number The code should consist of numbers only, with a maximum of four digits, and each code must be unique. Please note that expenses can have the same name, but they cannot have the same code. If you attempt to assign a code that is already in use, you will receive an error message stating "Expense number already exists." Name* Give your Expense a name so that it can be identified at the POS. This is limited to no more than 50 characters. Tax Tax assigned to the specific Expense. Editing an Expense To modify an expense, simply choose the expense you wish to change. This action will prompt the Expenses window to appear. Cancel Button: This will return you to the list of expenses. Delete Button: Once you initiate the process of removing an expense, you will be prompted to confirm the deletion. After confirmation, you will receive a notification indicating that the expense has been successfully deleted. Save Button: Use this to keep any changes that you make.

Creating an Expense

On the Expenses page, you will see your current expenses listed.



To begin making a new Expense use the "Add Expense" button, this will take you to a new page. 

After completing the form, select the "Save" button. Once the form has been saved, a notification will display to confirm the successful save. 


Please keep in mind that after creating your expenses, you will need to link them to a group for them to be accessible through the POS system. This can be accomplished using the Groups module. When utilizing the Expenses feature via the POS, the expenses will be arranged in alphabetical order and identified by their assigned number. Additional information can be found in the Make Expense section. 



Number
The code should consist of numbers only, with a maximum of four digits, and each code must be unique. Please note that expenses can have the same name, but they cannot have the same code. If you attempt to assign a code that is already in use, you will receive an error message stating "Expense number already exists."
Name*
Give your Expense a name so that it can be identified at the POS. This is limited to no more than 50 characters.
Tax
Tax assigned to the specific Expense.



Editing an Expense

To modify an expense, simply choose the expense you wish to change. This action will prompt the Expenses window to appear.  



Cancel Button: This will return you to the list of expenses.

Delete Button: Once you initiate the process of removing an expense, you will be prompted to confirm the deletion. After confirmation, you will receive a notification indicating that the expense has been successfully deleted. 

Save Button: Use this to keep any changes that you make.

title: Credit Memo
text: Within the backoffice, you can view your outstanding Credit Memos in each of the system currencies currently being used. The upper portion displays the aggregate value of your unpaid debts. You can utilize the available filters to refine your results. Moreover, you have the option to expire a particular or all vouchers listed in the filter. To conduct further analysis, you can export the list as a CSV file by utilizing the 'Download to CSV' feature.

title: Reason Codes
text: In this section, you can oversee and revise your Reason Codes. These codes are utilized to identify particular actions on the POS and can aid in future reporting. If you intend to modify a reason code, select the pencil icon, which will trigger a box to appear at the bottom of the page. To add a new Reason Code click ''Add Reason Code" and a box will appear at the bottom of the page. Ensure when you have finished amending or creating your new Code press ''Save Reason Code". Code User-defined numerical code, a maximum of 20 numbers long. Avoid using a number already in use. Description User-defined User-defined User-defined alpha-numerical code, maximum of 50 characters long. Descriptions for Discount type reason codes are printed on the receipt. Reason Type Option for Discount, Return or Other. Discount reason codes will show when you apply a discount at the POS. Return reason codes will show when you chose to return an item(s) on the POS. Other is an arbitrary type, including stock edits. Reason Scope You have the option of how the Reason code is shown by Line, Receipt or Receipt and Line. Line (when applied to discount reason codes) – will show discount reason codes at line level i.e. when you apply a discount for a single item. Line (when applied to return reason codes) - will show return reason codes for items you scan or search for at the POS. Receipt (when applied to discount reason codes) – will show discount reason codes at the transaction level i.e. when you apply a discount for all items (generally this is done via the POS Total line) Receipt (when applied to return reason codes) - will show for items you return via the receipt, either by scanning the receipt barcode or looking up the receipt via the Find Receipt button Receipt and Line (when applied to any reason code) - will show via both the Line and Receipt methods for your discount or return. Active Whether the Reason code is active or not. This option is only shown after a reason code is Saved (by default all new reason codes are initially Active). Inactive Reason Codes are not available at the POS. Offline This option shows for Return Reason Types only and allows the clerk to say whether the item is in a condition to be sold or not. Items that cannot go back to the shop floor should be marked as Offline.

Option for Discount, Return or Other.

  • Discount reason codes will show when you apply a discount at the POS.
  • Return reason codes will show when you chose to return an item(s) on the POS.
  • Other is an arbitrary type, including stock edits. 
Reason Scope

You have the option of how the Reason code is shown by Line, Receipt or Receipt and Line.

  • Line (when applied to discount reason codes) – will show discount reason codes at line level i.e. when you apply a discount for a single item.
  • Line (when applied to return reason codes) - will show return reason codes for items you scan or search for at the POS.
  • Receipt (when applied to discount reason codes) – will show discount reason codes at the transaction level i.e. when you apply a discount for all items (generally this is done via the POS Total line)
  • Receipt (when applied to return reason codes) - will show for items you return via the receipt, either by scanning the receipt barcode or looking up the receipt via the Find Receipt button
  • Receipt and Line (when applied to any reason code) - will show via both the Line and Receipt methods for your discount or return.

Whether the Reason code is active or not. This option is only shown after a reason code is Saved (by default all new reason codes are initially Active). Inactive Reason Codes are not available at the POS.

title: Payment Types
text: In the POS configuration section, you can customize the list of available "Payment Types" to suit your needs. This table displays the default payment types provided by Imagine, along with any custom payment types you have created. To modify the order of the payment types, simply drag and drop them to your preferred location. Remember to save your changes to ensure they are applied. It's important to note that any changes made to the payment type order will be reflected in the POS layout during usage. Please keep in mind that certain attributes of default payment types, such as their name, image URL, or payment strategy, cannot be altered. Is active in the POS This feature manages the activation status of payment types in the POS. By switching the toggle, you can effortlessly activate or deactivate a payment option. If disabled, the payment type will be entirely removed from the POS, in contrast to other buttons that may only become unavailable. Should be reconciled This setting determines which payment types must be accounted for and documented in the 'Cash Statement' at the end of the day. You can control this by enabling or disabling each payment type as needed. Opens the drawer when used. This enables/disables ‘cash drawer’ functionality at the POS for the selected payment type. Additional Notes Card To makes the Card payment type visible on the payment list of the POS, you must choose the "Is active in the POS" option and activate an integrated card solution. This feature can be accessed through the "Manage K3 Connector" menu in the 'Admin' module. If an integrated card solution has not been activated, the Card payment type will remain hidden from the payment list on the POS. Account To configures the Account payment type, use the 'Payment Types' settings like any other payment method. However, it will only appear on the POS if the 'Customer' widget has been enabled. For additional information, refer to the POS widgets section. Currency In contrast to other payment methods that can be configured through the 'Payment Types' settings, the Foreign Currency payment method is constantly displayed on the payment list in the POS. Nevertheless, it can only be activated once a foreign currency has been included in the Shop Setup section of the Admin module. Loyalty Bonus This payment method is not configured through the 'Payment Types' settings. It will only be displayed on the POS when a customer is selected who has earned loyalty points. For further information on how Loyalty works, please see the Loyalty section. Custom Payment Types If you require a payment option that is not on the list of default options then you can add a new payment type. To add a new Payment Type press the + Symbol, this will add an empty line to the list. Payment Type Name This will be displayed on the POS and receipts. Is active in the POS Check this box for the payment type to be active in the POS. Should be reconciled Check this box if the payment type is to be counted and recorded on the end-of-day cash statement. Icon URL Images can be assigned to custom payment types only. These are displayed on the POS payment buttons. A URL address for the image is required. Payment Strategy This determines how the custom Payment type will function Default Functions like a cash sale. Default Card functions Functions like a card sale. Default Foreign Voucher functions Functions like a foreign Gift Certificate. Ensure you press Save to keep your new payment type.

title: Taxes in Back Office
text: Tax Groups are a collection of tax rates that are applied to specific products or services. These tax rates are determined by factors such as the product category, country, region, or state where the transaction takes place. In a point-of-sale (POS) system, taxes are grouped to identify the tax owed on a sale of an item in a particular location. By assigning a tax group to a product or service, the system can quickly determine the appropriate tax rate to apply to the transaction. Tax Groups can be configured to support different tax scenarios, such as varying tax rates for different regions, or tax exemptions for certain products or services. Effective management of tax groups can help ensure accurate tax reporting, minimise errors, and streamline the sales process. Tax Codes are the individual taxes within a Group, such as Standard rate, Reduced rate, Zero rate etc. These can be timed to come in to effect if needed. Within the Taxes area you can make modifications to your existing Tax Groups and Codes, and you can create new Tax Groups and Codes to suit your business needs. Tax Groups Allows for the creation of new Tax Groups through the Add Tax Group button. The Search bar will allow you to search on the Tax Group Name or Number of Tax Codes to allow for easy identification of the existing Tax Group. Add Tax Group Click the Add Tax Group button to add a new group. Tax Group Name Identify the tax group by name, can be letters, numbers and special characters. Can be a maximum of 50 characters. This is the name you use to identify the Tax Group in other areas of Imagine. This name must be unique across your list of Tax Groups Tax Code Name Identify the tax code by name, can be letters, numbers and special characters. Can be a maximum of 50 characters. Additional tax codes can be added after the initial creation. See the "modifying tax groups" section below. . This is the name you use to identify the Tax Code in other areas of Imagine Percent A decimal number, up to two decimal places that is zero or greater. This Percent is the default percentage and is used to calculate tax liability, therefore must be accurate. Once created additional tax code percentage can be added along with "valid from" times After the initial creation you will be given the opportunity to add additional tax codes. When you are finished you should use the Back button to complete and save your changes. See the "modifying tax groups" section below. Overview Lists all your existing Tax Groups and the number of tax codes associated with that group. Tax Group Name As given in the Tax Group Name when creating or editing a Tax Group Number of Tax Groups The number of tax codes associated with the group Modifying Tax Groups and Tax Codes To modify a Tax Group, click on the individual tax group name, and you will be directed to the Tax Group page. Here you can edit the Tax Group Name as well as create new and edit existing tax rates. Note: when editing the Tax Group Name, remember this name must be unique across your list of Tax group Names. You must click the save icon for name changes to complete When you have completed editing your tax codes click the Back button to return to the overview screen To delete the entire Tax Group, use the Delete button, and then click on the orange banner to confirm the action. This action cannot be undone Use the + button to add a new tax code or tax percentage Use the edit icon to alter the name of the tax rate Use the save icon to save changes Use the cancel icon to discard any changes you have made Use the delete icon to remove completely the tax rate Name Name of the tax code, can be letters, numbers or special characters up to 30 characters in length. The Tax Group Name must be unique. when compared to other Tax Group Names in your list Default Percentage Tax Code percentage, as a decimal number, up to two decimal places. This percentage you cannot remove individually and will be the 'default' value where another percentage is not valid. Tax Percentage The tax percentage. as a decimal number, up to two decimal places. Valid From A date from which this percentage comes in to use. This could be for a temporary tax change or to implement a tax change outside of office hours. The "default" percentage does not have this function. Any percentage that is valid by the given date will continue to be valid until it is superseded by a new value or deleted. The Valid From date is inclusive, that is it comes into force at 00:00:01 on the date selected Note: tax codes ensure, when a transaction is completed in a shop, that the correct tax percentage due for that item is recorded. In order to do this there are several other areas to consider when setting up taxes Each Shop must have a Tax Group assigned. Shops must know for each given item, whether they can apply to the item a corresponding Tax Code inline with the shops Tax Group (and thus what tax percentage they should apply to the transaction). Without this information a shop cannot sell the item. Knowing this can be via the Primary Group, the Group or the Tax Group assigned in Shop Configuration. It is possible to have tax groups assigned in all of these areas, so Imagine will check firstly in the Primary Group, then in the Groups (in order of the listed Groups), and finally in the Shop Configuration - Tax Group for the Tax Code to apply. It is not possible to create or edit a shop so that it does not have a Tax Group configured Each item can be assigned a Tax Code from each Tax Group. Each shop will then be able to list items for sale where the shops Tax Group matches the items Tax Code Item Hierarchies require a Tax Code per Tax Group in a similar fashion to Items. This allows for collecting the correct tax on Item Group sales

Tax Groups are a collection of tax rates that are applied to specific products or services. These tax rates are determined by factors such as the product category, country, region, or state where the transaction takes place.


In a point-of-sale (POS) system, taxes are grouped to identify the tax owed on a sale of an item in a particular location. By assigning a tax group to a product or service, the system can quickly determine the appropriate tax rate to apply to the transaction.


Tax Groups can be configured to support different tax scenarios, such as varying tax rates for different regions, or tax exemptions for certain products or services. Effective management of tax groups can help ensure accurate tax reporting, minimise errors, and streamline the sales process.


Tax Codes are the individual taxes within a Group, such as Standard rate, Reduced rate, Zero rate etc. These can be timed to come in to effect if needed.


Within the Taxes area you can make modifications to your existing Tax Groups and Codes, and you can create new Tax Groups and Codes to suit your business needs.


Tax Groups

Tax Group Name
Identify the tax group by name, can be letters, numbers and special characters. Can be a maximum of 50 characters. This is the name you use to identify the Tax Group in other areas of Imagine. This name must be unique across your list of Tax Groups 
Tax Code Name
Identify the tax code by name, can be letters, numbers and special characters. Can be a maximum of 50 characters. Additional tax codes can be added after the initial creation. See the "modifying tax groups" section below. . This is the name you use to identify the Tax Code in other areas of Imagine
Percent A decimal number, up to two decimal places that is zero or greater. This Percent is the default percentage and is used to calculate tax liability, therefore must be accurate. Once created additional tax code percentage can be added along with "valid from" times


After the initial creation you will be given the opportunity to add additional tax codes. When you are finished you should use the Back button to complete and save your changes. See the "modifying tax groups" section below.


Overview

Lists all your existing Tax Groups and the number of tax codes associated with that group.


Tax Group NameAs given in the Tax Group Name when creating or editing a Tax Group
Number of Tax Groups The number of tax codes associated with the group


Modifying Tax Groups and Tax Codes

To modify a Tax Group, click on the individual tax group name, and you will be directed to the Tax Group page. Here you can edit the Tax Group Name as well as create new and edit existing tax rates.


Note: when editing the Tax Group Name, remember this name must be unique across your list of Tax group Names. You must click the save icon for name changes to complete


When you have completed editing your tax codes click the Back button to return to the overview screen

To delete the entire Tax Group, use the Delete button, and then click on the orange banner to confirm the action. This action cannot be undone

Use the + button to add a new tax code or tax percentage
Use the edit icon to alter the name of the tax rate
Use the save icon to save changes
Use the cancel icon to discard any changes you have made
Use the delete icon to remove completely the tax rate
Name
Name of the tax code, can be letters, numbers or special characters up to 30 characters in length. The Tax Group Name must be unique. when compared to other Tax Group Names in your list
Default Percentage
Tax Code percentage, as a decimal number, up to two decimal places. This percentage you cannot remove individually and will be the 'default' value where another percentage is not valid. 
Tax PercentageThe tax percentage. as a decimal number, up to two decimal places.
Valid FromA date from which this percentage comes in to use. This could be for a temporary tax change or to implement a tax change outside of office hours. The "default" percentage does not have this function. Any percentage that is valid by the given date will continue to be valid until it is superseded by a new value or deleted. The Valid From date is inclusive, that is it comes into force at 00:00:01 on the date selected


Note: tax codes ensure, when a transaction is completed in a shop, that the correct tax percentage due for that item is recorded. In order to do this there are several other areas to consider when setting up taxes

  • Each Shop must have a Tax Group assigned. Shops must know for each given item, whether they can apply to the item a corresponding Tax Code inline with the shops Tax Group (and thus what tax percentage they should apply to the transaction). Without this information a shop cannot sell the item. Knowing this can be via the Primary Group, the Group or the Tax Group assigned in Shop Configuration. It is possible to have tax groups assigned in all of these areas, so Imagine will check firstly in the Primary Group, then in the Groups (in order of the listed Groups), and finally in the Shop Configuration - Tax Group for the Tax Code to apply. It is not possible to create or edit a shop so that it does not have a Tax Group configured
  • Each item can be assigned a Tax Code from each Tax Group. Each shop will then be able to list items for sale where the shops Tax Group matches the items Tax Code
  • Item Hierarchies require a Tax Code per Tax Group in a similar fashion to Items. This allows for collecting the correct tax on Item Group sales

title: Groups
text: The Groups module enables you to group shops. By adding shops to a group, they will adopt the settings applied to that particular group, such as Reason Codes, Expenses, Tax Codes, and Item Groups. As a result, only the selected options for that group will appear in the POS. You can create an unlimited number of groups, but it is mandatory to select a group in Shops, so you must create at least one group. However, the options within the groups are not compulsory. To create a new group click ''ADD GROUP'' and a new page will open. The Options will apply to any shop with this group selected, meaning Tax Group Code, Reason Code, Expenses and Item Hierarchy selections will effect what options are available at the PoS. For example, if a group uses Tax codes FR and UK, a shop which trades in GBP will automatically use the UK tax codes. Tax Group Code: will determine the tax code applied to a shop Reason Codes: when applied to the shop, only the listed reason Codes will be available at the PoS Expenses: when applied to the shop, only the listed Expenses will be available at the PoS Item Hierarchy: when applied to shop the Item Hierarchy selection affects which Item Groups can be used on the PoS for miscellaneous sales. Note that this is also effected by the Tax Rates applied to the individual Hierarchy Node To amend or delete a Group click on the name and it will open a new page. When you have made the amends ensure you press save or delete to remove the group.

title: Gift Vouchers
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Sum of Outstanding Balances of Each Summary Table Filters Gift Voucher Details Expiring a Gift Voucher Download as CSV The Gift Voucher module provides an overview of all outstanding gift vouchers in each of your system's currencies. You can utilize this section to break down the gift vouchers into individual ones and filter them by their status. Additionally, you can choose to display only the expired gift vouchers if needed. Sum of Outstanding Balances of Each Summary In this section, you can view the total sum of your outstanding liabilities, which are displayed per currency (if applicable). If a gift voucher has not been issued for a specific currency, it will not be shown in this section. The values for each currency are calculated when the page is initially loaded, and the date and time of this calculation are provided. If you suspect that the totals have been updated since the page was loaded, you can use the Refresh button to recalculate the sum. Table Filters You can use the provided filters to narrow down your lists. Use the From and To filters to narrow down the date range. The dates are inclusive of the dates set. The Show drop-down will give you a list of status of the gift vouchers. The following table details the Status and their meanings. Use the Show drop-down to see a set of gift vouchers with a specific Status Status Meaning All Gift Vouchers with any status as listed here. Open Gift Voucher's that have been issued from the POS and also have a Current Amount greater than 0. title: Data Export
text: The data export utility is a generic tool for exporting Imagine retail data. While it was primarily developed to meet Germany's fiscal compliance requirements, it generates a zip file that includes a .dtd file and CSV files that represent the data in the Imagine database. Any example use-case might be if you want to download a file with all of your products, their item numbers, and their barcodes. The data tree provides a catalogue of tables in the database. To see the available options, simply click the "+" icon to expand the selection. You can then select which filters you wish to include within the Data Export. NOTE: Some filters will have additional options when selected along with a toggle to enable if required. If you toggle a specific field, you can opt to filter the data based on a value you provide. Once you have chosen the data you wish to export for all pertinent tables, click the Start Export button located at the top. After initiating the data export task, it may take a while to complete, depending on the amount of data you have chosen to export. If it is taking longer than expected, keep checking back, as it will continue to process in the background. Once it is ready, you will receive an email containing a download link. Upon completion, you will see a download button, which you can use to access your exported data. Please note that downloads are only available for two days.

title: Mobile Pay
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Configuration Add POS Create a QR Code Mobile Pay is a payment system based on a phone application used in Denmark. Imagine has integrated Mobile Pay into its system, allowing customers to scan a unique QR code at the point of sale to view the transaction total and authorize payment. For further details about the customer mobile app, please visit https://www.mobilepay.dk/ Configuration Before configuring each POS and Shop for Mobile Pay, several tenant-level settings must be configured. Firstly, you must enter the merchant brand ID. If this has not been entered, the system will display the following message. Click on Settings and enter your merchant ID and click Save. Once the Merchant Brand ID is set the Add POS button will be enabled. Add POS Clicking add POS will display the following screen. Shop* Select from the drop-down which shops you are adding the POS too. Connector* Select which connector you wish to use. Merchant Location ID* Enter the Merchant Location ID provided by Mobile Pay for this shop and click on "Lookup Store". It is important to note that the company number for this store must match the one provided by Mobile Pay. Beacon ID / Type The Beacon ID is a 12-digit number that serves to uniquely identify this POS among all Mobile Pay merchants. Enter the ID, which should contain 12 digits, and select both QR Code Beacon and Bluetooth Beacon options. Create a QR Code You can create a QR Code using any QR Code creator, but the content must follow the below format. Make sure to replace 123456789012 with your beacon ID. mobilepaypos://pos?id=123456789012&source=qr The below example was created at https://www.the-qrcode-generator.com/

title: Fiskaly
text: Fiskaly is a cloud-based fiscalization platform that offers compliance solutions for businesses operating in various industries. It is designed to help businesses meet tax compliance regulations and protect themselves against fiscal fraud. Fiskaly provides a range of services, including hardware security modules, a point of sale app, and APIs for integrating with other software applications. The platform is mainly used in Europe, particularly in Germany and Austria, where fiscal compliance regulations are strict and require businesses to use certified systems to manage their financial transactions.

title: Item Info
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS There are several examples of how Item Info can be used, such as: Examples of gathering information to gain insights about your customers or sales include: Item Info overview Adding Item Info Linking an Item Info to an Item The Item Info feature is used to include supplementary details about an item at the point of sale or to collect further information regarding the purchase of the item. There are several examples of how Item Info can be used, such as: Assisting the clerk in providing more detailed information about items to the customer. Reminding the clerk about up-selling or cross-selling opportunities. Providing advice to the customer about the item they are purchasing. Verifying the customer's age. Examples of gathering information to gain insights about your customers or sales include: The Item Info feature can also be used to: Request the customer's permission to receive promotional material via email from the business. Collect anonymous and non-intrusive demographic information about the customer base, such as gender, age range, and whether the customer is shopping alone or in a group. Furthermore, the data captured through Item Info can be associated with the transaction (either at the header or detail level) and stored for reporting purposes in the future. Item Info overview After clicking on Item Info you will be presented with a list of already created Item Info. Add Item Info Clicking on the "Add Item Info" button will lead the user to the screen where they can create new Item Info. Edit Button This enables editing of any previously created Item Info. Delete Button This allows deleting an Item Info. NOTE: Item Info should only be deleted when it is no longer in use. Active Check Box This feature enables the user to mark an Item Info as active or inactive by assigning a tick and then saving the changes. By default, newly created Item info is active. It is recommended not to delete an Item's Info until it has been marked as inactive. Prompt Every This is the point where the prompt will be displayed to the cashier. Adding Item Info Description Displays the description for any Item Info that has been created Info Type Displays the type of information for any created Item Info, which can be either Info or Question. Prompt Every Shows the selected prompt frequency for any created Item info on the POS, which can be Line or Transaction. Transaction: The message or question should only be presented once during a transaction when the same item is scanned. For example, if I purchase three identical items, I would prefer the clerk to suggest batteries only once, rather than repeating the suggestion three times. Line: The message or question should be displayed every time an item is scanned. This is necessary because we may need to collect information or send a message about each item line, such as in the case of a sale of a pair of shoes where we need to confirm a matching pair. Remember to click "Save" when finished or "Back" to cancel any changes. Display Text This is the prompt/message text which will be displayed on the POS Custom Item Attribute The drop-down menu allows selecting the Custom Item Attributes that will activate the Item Info prompt at the POS. Please note that only Yes/No type Custom Attributes will appear in the drop-down list as they are the ones that link the item to the Item Info. Question Choices This field will only be displayed when the Info Type is set to Question. Here, the user can enter the options that the clerk can choose from, such as "Yes," "No," or "Maybe." Each choice should be saved by hitting Enter between them. All other required fields should be completed as needed. Linking an Item Info to an Item After creating and saving the Item Info, you must link it to an item. As previously mentioned, the Item Info must be linked to a Custom Attribute. The Custom Attributes Tab page provides instructions on how to link a Custom Attribute to an item. Once linked and the item is added to the transaction screen in the POS, the Item Info will be displayed.
